page.title: 07Education,Abermorddu Area
page.content: {Abermorddu County Primary School}has just over 180 full-time pupils aged from four to eleven, as well as having a part-time{Nursery unit}which can accommodate upto 27 pupils. Also on site are the local {pre-school {playgroup} and the {Community Centre. Pupils are drawn mainly from the villages of Abermorddu, Caergwrle, Cymau and Cefnybedd. A few pupils travel from the{farms}scattered over Hope Mountain and a small number come from the outskirts of Hope and Sydallt. The first school, opened in 1883, was demolished in 1983 when the second phase of the new school was opened on a site opposite the original school. The headteacher, Mr.Ian Swain, five full-time staff,three part-time teachers and two Nursery nurses are responsible for the pupils' education.
